musicalLanguage.description: The quintessential jazz standard. Originally a French chanson (Les Feuilles mortes, 1945), it became the vehicle every jazz musician learns to navigate ii-V-I progressions. The melody traces a descending sequence through the circle of fourths.
musicalLanguage.structure: AABC — 32-bar standard form. A sections establish the ii-V-I-IV in Bb major, B section shifts to relative minor (G minor), C resolves.
keyMoments: Opening phrase: the melody descends stepwise over Cm7-F7-BbMaj7-EbMaj7, outlining the circle of fourths
The pivot to G minor: where the major brightness shifts to minor melancholy
Final cadence: Am7b5-D7-Gm resolves the harmonic journey
teachingGoals: ii-V-I voice leading in major and minor keys
Guide tones (3rds and 7ths) through chord changes
Left-hand rootless voicings for jazz comping
Melodic phrasing with swing eighth notes
styleTips: Swing the eighth notes — long-short, not even
Let the left hand comp lightly, don't overpower the melody
Voice lead smoothly — minimize hand movement between chords
Think horizontally (melodic lines) not vertically (chord stacks)
